newsitem.title: FINLAND: FORECAST - Enso 1996 profit seen lower.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Enso 1996 profit seen lower.

text.p: A Reuters survey of analysts covering Finnish equities showed a 1,575 million markka median forecast for Finnish forestry group Enso Oy's full-year 1996 profit before extraordinary items and tax.
(Profit forecasts by 20 analysts, EPS by 18 analysts).
Enso's results are due on March 10 in the afternoon.
In 1995, Enso had a 3.5 billion markka profit after financial items.

Thirteen of the analysts polled also gave forecasts for Enso's dividend for 1996 with the median at 1.70 markka (mean 1.70 markka) in a 1.00 markka to 2.30 markka range. Enso paid a 2.25 markka dividend for 1995.
For the company's full-year 1997 profit, 16 of the 20 analysts polled gave a median forecast of 1,805 million markka (mean 1,847 million) in a 925-2,500 million markka range.

Contributors to the survey were AG Private Bankers, Aktia Bank, Alfred Berg, Aros Securities, BZW Securities, Carnegie Securities, Den Danske Bank, Enskilda Securities, Erik Selin, Evli Securities, FIM Securities, FSB, Handelsbanken, Interbank, Kleinwort Benson, Merita Securities, Opstock Securities, Paribas, Postipankki and UBS.
